meanings.definition: A low hill at the base of a mountain.
meanings.sent1: The foothill provided a gentle slope for the hikers to climb.
meanings.sent2: The cows grazed peacefully at the foothill.
meanings.sent3: The foothill seemed to be playing hide and seek with the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The foothill stood like a loyal guard at the foot of the mountain.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers bloomed abundantly on the foothill.

meanings.definition: The lower part of a hill or mountain.
meanings.sent1: We set up our campsite near the foothill for easy access to the trails.
meanings.sent2: The village was nestled in the foothill, overlooking the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The foothill appeared to be bowing to the taller mountain beside it.
meanings.sent4: The foothill cast a long shadow as the sun began to set behind it.
meanings.sent5: The birds chirped cheerfully as they flew over the foothill.
